columns.description: The water source can be either functional, or not functional.
columns.name: Functional

columns.description: This is the reason that the water source is not functional.
columns.name: Reason Broken

columns.description: The distribution type refers to whether this water source is distributed at a single point, or multiple points. For multiple point distributions, the type also classifies whether the water points served by the water source are roughly within 100 meters, within 1000 meters (1 km), or beyond 1 kilometer.
columns.name: Distribution Type

columns.description: The water source requires payment in order for someone to use/draw water.
columns.name: Fees for use

columns.description: The primary/main lift mechanism for the water source. A lift mechanism is the way water is brought to the surface for people to use and can include a variety of methods, such as diesel pumps, hand pumps, animal powered pumps etc.
columns.name: Lift Mechanism

columns.description: The community this water source is in.
columns.name: Community

columns.description: The ward this water source is in.
columns.name: Ward

columns.description: The water source can be either improved, or unimproved.
columns.name: Improved

columns.description: The type/kind of water source, such as borehole, protected dug well, developed/protected spring water, or a rainwater harvesting scheme.
columns.name: Type

columns.description: This is the proportion of children at the school who demonstrate  adequate ability to perform and understand basic maths.
columns.descriptive_name: Proportion of children with basic numeracy skills (TBD)
columns.name: Proportion of children who can do basic numeracy (TBD)

columns.description: This is the proportion of children at the school who demonstrate  adequate ability to acquire knowledge and to develop attitudes and skills which support the adoption of healthy behaviours.
columns.descriptive_name: Proportion of children with life skills (TBD)
columns.name: Proportion of children who can do life skills (TBD)

columns.description: This is the proportion of children at the school who demonstrate  adequate ability to read and write.
columns.descriptive_name: Proportion of children with basic literacy
columns.name: Proportion of children who can do basic literacy (TBD)

columns.description: The school gives its students pens and pencils
columns.name: Pens/pencils provided

columns.description: Teachers at the school have a Ministry of Education issued/approved teacher's guide or syllabus for all subjects
columns.name: Teaching guidebook for every teacher for every subject

columns.description: The school has a room or building that houses books and other materials students and staff can access.
columns.name: Functioning Library

columns.description: School has separate toilets for boys and girls. Gender separated toilets are defined as those that are only for women or girls and other facilities only for men or boys. If  toilets are shared and are for use by women, girls, men and boys then the school does not have gender separated toilets.
columns.name: Gender-separated toilet(s)

columns.description: This is the proportion of students to toilets at each school.
columns.name: Pupil to toilet ratio

columns.description: The school has a health clinic for students and staff. The aim behind this indicator is to find out whether the school is prepared to manage very basic injuries that happen to students or staff. A school is counted as having a health clinic if the respondnet explicitly said there is a health clinic for students and staff.
columns.name: Dispensary / Health Clinic

columns.description: The school has a first aid kit that can be used for students and staff.  The aim behind this indicator is to find out whether the school is is prepared to manage very basic injuries that happen to students or staff. A school is counted as having a first aid kit if the respondnet explicitly said there is a first aid kit for students and staff. The school does not have a health clinic but just a first aid kit.
columns.descriptive_name: First aid kit ONLY (not a health clinic)
columns.name: First-aid kit only (no health clinic)

columns.description: Teachers were not paid on time at least once in the last 12 months
columns.descriptive_name: Delayed teacher payments in the past 12 months
columns.name: Delayed teacher payments in the past 12 months

columns.description: Teachers were not paid at all at least once in the last 12 months
columns.descriptive_name: Missed teacher payments in past 12 months
columns.name: Missed teacher payments in the past 12 months

columns.description: The school gives its students exercise books
columns.name: Exercise books provided

columns.description: The school's boundary wall or fence or some other demarcation of the school area is in good condition. Assessment of the condition of the  school's fences/boundary walls condition is not based on a measurement but on the respondent's knowledge of and subjective judgement of the fence/wall condition.
columns.name: Wall/fence in good condition

columns.description: This is the ratio of the number of students at the school to the number of classrooms available.
columns.name: Pupil to classroom ratio

columns.description: The school does not have enough classrooms and as a result some classes are held outside.
columns.descriptive_name: Teach outside because there are not enough classrooms
columns.name: Teach outside because there are not enough classrooms

columns.description: The school teaches in shifts throughout the day. If the school operates in a single shift, only one group of students is being taught during the day. If another group of students comes after the first group has finished and uses the same classrooms and facilities, the school operates in double shifts.  Schools can have morning and afternoon shifts or they can have shifts that overlap.
columns.name: Double shifts

columns.description: The school has classrooms that are used for more than one class on a regular basis.
columns.name: Multi-grade classrooms

columns.description: This is the  number of teachers at the school who attended a training or were sent for training in the past 12 months
columns.descriptive_name: Teachers who participated in training in the past 12 months
columns.name: Teachers who participated in training in the past 12 months

columns.description: This is the total number of teachers in each school.
columns.name: Total number of teachers

columns.description: This is the ratio of the number of students at the school to the number of benches available at the school.
columns.name: Pupil to bench ratio

columns.description: This is the ratio of the number of students at the school to the number of desks avaiable
columns.name: Pupil to desk ratio

columns.description: The school has>20% students who live more than 3kms away. This indicator measures how easily students can access a school. The assumption is that students are more likely to attend school if they do not live very far away from the school or if the school is within a reasonable distance from where the population it serves live.
columns.descriptive_name: More than 20% of students living more than 3km away from school
columns.name: More than 20% students living farther than 3km from school

columns.description: The ratio of boys to girls enrolled at the school. The indicator is a ratio of the number of  enrolled boys to enrolled girls, regardless of ages. It measures the equality of educational opportunity, measured in terms of school enrolment, for boys and girls
columns.name: Ratio boys to girls

columns.description: School had access to improved sanitation/toilets for at least three weeks in the month before data was collected. It is assumed that improved sanitation reduces the risk of contact with waste and thus leads to a reduction in certain diseases. Improved sanitation is defined as sewers or septic tanks, poor-flush latrines and simple pit or ventilated improved pit latrines that are not for public use and are meant for use by staff and students.
columns.name: Access to improved sanitation/toilet

columns.description: The school uses the Ministry of Education issued/approved curriculum for all subjects
columns.name: Follow the national UBE curriculum

columns.description: The primary school is more than 1 km from the nearest secondary school. This indicator measures how easily students can access secondary education. The assumption is that students are more likely to attend secondary schools if they are easily accessible and are not located very far away from where the primary school or catchment area is.
columns.descriptive_name: More than 1km from nearest secondary school
columns.name: Farther than 1km from nearest secondary school

columns.description: Every classroom at the school has a chalkboard
columns.name: Chalkboards in every classroom

columns.description: This is the number of teachers at the school who have an NCE
columns.name: Qualified teachers (with NCE)

columns.description: This is the ratio of the number of textbooks at the schools to the number of textbooks.
columns.name: Textbook to pupil ratio

columns.description: The ratio of pupils to teachers at the school
columns.name: Pupil to teacher ratio

columns.description: This is the ratio of staff at the school who teach (teachers who are in permanent or temporary/part-time positions and both qualified and unqualified teachers) and do not teach (non-teaching staff are the number of male and female staff who do not teach and are classified as pay scale grade 7 and up).
columns.name: Teacher to non-teaching staff

columns.description: Number of classrooms at the school that are in need of major repair.
columns.descriptive_name: Number of classrooms needing major repair
columns.name: Classroom(s) that need major repairs

columns.description: The school is more than 1 km from the catchment area/areas it is supposed to serve. This indicator measures how easily students can access a school.
columns.name: Farther than 1km from catchment area

columns.description:
School had potable water, without interruption, for at least three weeks in the past month. The indicator monitors access to safe water sources based on the assumption that
such sources are more likely to provide safe water and reduce the incidence of diseases caused by drinking/using unsafe water.
columns.name: Access to potable water

columns.description: Number of classrooms at the school that are in need of only minor repairs
columns.descriptive_name: Number of classrooms needing minor repair
columns.name: Classroom(s) that need minor repairs

columns.description: School buildings have rooves that are described as being in good condition. Assessment of the school buildings rooves' condition is not based on a measurement but on the respondent's knowledge of and subjective judgement of the rooves condition.
columns.name: Roof in good condition

columns.description: School Name
columns.name: Name

columns.description: School had power for at least three weeks in the month before the data was collected. Access to power is defined as having power for at least three weeks in the month before the data was collected. This indicator measures how consistent and reliable the school's power source is.   If there was always at least one working power source in the month before data collection and if the school had power for 5 or more hours a day then the school is considered as having reliable and consistent power.
columns.name: Access to power

columns.description: Facility offers anti-retroviral (ARV) drugs to treat HIV/AIDS.
columns.name: ARV Treatment

columns.description: Facility has had a stockout of essental medications (antimalarials, antidiarrheals or antibiotics) for at least one week in the month prior to data collection.
columns.name: Drug Stock Outs

columns.description: Facility charges fees for health services.
columns.name: User fees

columns.description: Facility has IV treatments available.
columns.name: IV treatments available

columns.description: Facility offers curative care 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
columns.name: 24/7 Curative Care

columns.description: Facility offers inpatient care.
columns.name: Inpatient Care

columns.description: Facility has access to potable water source that is currently functional.
columns.name: Potable water

columns.description: Facility had access to toilets/latrines for at least three weeks in the month prior to data collection.
columns.name: Toilets/latrines

columns.description: Facility has a currently functioning mobile coverage on the premises.
columns.name: Mobile Coverage

columns.description: Facility has access to a power source that is currently functional.
columns.name: Power

columns.name: TB testing

columns.description: Facility offers treatment of tuberculosis.
columns.name: TB treatment

columns.description: Facility offers testing of HIV.

columns.description: Facility has access to a power source that is currently functional.
columns.name: Power

columns.description: Facility offers either malaria rapid diagnostic test (RDT) or malaria microscopy.
